info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 5:22PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Wheatland, northwestern Sweet Grass and north central Park Counties through 545 PM MDT... At 522 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles north of Clyde Park, or 29 miles north of Livingston, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Wheatland, northwestern Sweet Grass and north central Park Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for south central and central Montana.
